Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of the same, that a certain Act approved July 26, 1920, fixing the compensation of commissioners of roads and revenues in and for said county be and the same is hereby amended by amending Section 1 of said Act which reads as follows: That the chairman of said board shall receive five hundred dollars ($500.00) per annum for his services and that the other commissioners shall receive four hundred dollars ($400.00) per annum in full for their services; so that said section shall read as follows: That the commissioners of roads and revenues of Spalding County are authorized to fix the compensation to be paid the chairman of the board of roads and revenues of said county, at an amount not to exceed nine hundred dollars ($900.00) per annum, in full for his services, and the compensation of other commissioners
of roads and revenues for said county be fixed by the board at an amount not to exceed seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00) each per annum, in full for their services. This amendment to take effect on and after January 1, 1930. Salaries of chairman of board and commissioners.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be and the same are hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to amend an Act to provide for county commissioners of roads and revenues for the County of Stephens, and for other purposes, approved August 19, 1918, Georgia Laws 1918, pages 492, et seq., and for other purposes. It is hereby enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia that an Act to provide for county commissioners of roads and revenues for the County of Stephens, and for other purposes, be and the same is hereby amended as follows:
law.p: Section 1. By striking Section 8 of said Act and inserting in lieu thereof the following: Section 8. Each of said county commissioners shall be paid a salary of twenty ($20.00) dollars per month, beginning with the passage of this Act. Salary of commissioners.

Sec. 2. By striking Section 11 of said Act and inserting in lieu thereof the following: Section 11. As of the close of business on May 31st of each year, the county commissioners shall have a complete audit made of the fiscal affairs of the county. Said audit shall show the date, source, and amount of all receipts; the date, amount, and payee of all disbursements; the date, amount, and payee of all unpaid county warrants; the date, amount, and payee of all other written obligations; the date, amount, and payee of
all open accounts; a statement showing the bonded indebtedness of the county. Such financial report shall be verified by the chairman of the board of commissioners of roads and revenues or by the clerk of said board. A copy of such report of the county commissioners shall be furnished the ordinary for his files, and a copy shall be exhibited to the grand jury meeting first after such report is made. In the discretion of the county commissioners, all receipts and disbursements may be published in the newspaper in which sheriff's sales are advertised in said county, and the cost thereof paid from county funds. Audit and report.

Sec. 3. By amending Section 18 of said Act by striking the words two weeks and inserting in lieu thereof the words one week, so that said section when amended shall read as follows: When it shall be deemed wise by the board to sell any personal property belonging to the county, the same shall be sold at public outcry at the court-house door in Toccoa, after publishing notice of the sale in the official organ of the county for one week prior to such sale. Notice of sale of personal property of county.
Sec. 4. By striking from said Act Section 22.
Sec. 5. All laws in conflict with this Act are hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: To be entitled an Act to amend Section Four of an Act approved August 15, 1916, amendatory of an Act creating a road law for the County of Tattnall, approved July 31, 1915, so as to change the time for collection of commutation road tax for said County of Tattnall from October 1st of each year to August 1st of each year.
law.p:
Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of same,
that from and after the passage of this Act that Section Four of the Act approved August 15, 1916, amendatory of the Act creating the road law for the County of Tattnall, approved July 31, 1915, is hereby amended by striking said Section Four of said Act approved August 15, 1916, and substituting therefor the following section, to be known and numbered as Section Four, as follows: Section Four. Be it enacted by authority aforesaid, that the commutation road tax due to the County of Tattnall under the Act approved August 15, 1916, and the Act of which it is amendatory, shall become due and payable and shall be collectible, beginning with the first day of August in each and every year after the passage of this Act; provided that any and every person who shall have resided in the County of Tattnall for a period of time as long as ten days prior to the first day of August of any year, such person or persons shall be subject to road duty. Road-tax due Aug. 1.
Sec. 2. Be it enacted by the authority aforesaid, that all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be and the same are hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to amend an Act entitled An Act to create a board of commissioners of roads and revenues for the County of Telfair; to define their powers and prescribe their duties, and for other purposes, so as to increase the salary of the chairman of said board.
law.p:
Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of the same, that the Act entitled An Act to create a board of commissioners of roads and revenues for the County of
Telfair; to define their powers and prescribe their duties, and for other purposes, contained in the Acts of 1923, page 317 et seq., and approved July 19, 1923, be and the same is hereby amended by striking from the second line of paragraph 10 of said Act the marks and figures as follows, to wit: $50.00, and inserting in lieu thereof the marks and figures, to wit, $100.00, so that when said Act is amended as herein provided the salary of the chairman of the board of commissioners created by said Act will be changed from $50.00 per month to $100.00 per month; and no other amount may be paid said chairman of said board. Chairman's salary.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that this Act shall become effective from the date of its passage.
Sec. 3. Be it further enacted, that all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be and the same are hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to amend an Act entitled An Act to create a board of commissioners of roads and revenues for the County of Telfair; to define their powers and prescribe their duties, and for other purposes, so as to increase the salary of the chairman of said board.
law.p:
Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of the same, that the Act entitled An Act to create a board of commissioners of roads and revenues for the County of Telfair; to define their powers and prescribe their duties, and for other purposes, contained in the Acts of 1923, page 317 et seq., and approved July 19, 1923, be
and the same is hereby amended by striking from the second line of paragraph 10 of said Act the marks and figures as follows, to wit: $50.00, and inserting in lieu thereof the marks and figures, to wit: $100.00, so that when said Act is amended as herein provided the salary of the chairman of the board of commissioners created by said Act will be changed from $50.00 per month to $100.00 per month; and no other amount may be paid said chairman of said board. Duplicate of preceding Act (No. 220).
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that this Act shall become effective from the date of its passage.
Sec. 3. Be it further enacted, that all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be and the same are hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to amend Section 11 of an Act approved August 17, 1927, entitled An Act to abolish the office of tax-receiver and tax-collector of Tift County, Georgia, to create the office of tax-commissioner of Tift County, Georgia; to fix the term and compensation of such officer, prescribe his duties and to fix the sum of his official bond, and for other purposes.
law.p:
Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of same, that from and after the passage of this Act, the Act approved August 17, 1927, entitled An Act to abolish the office of tax-receiver and tax-collector of Tift County, Georgia, to create the office of tax-commissioner of Tift County, Georgia, to fix the term and compensation of said officer, prescribe his duties, and fix the sum of his official
bond, and for other purposes, be and the same is hereby amended by striking from section 11, beginning in the 4th line thereof, the words: and shall give bond in double the amount reasonably estimated to pass through his hands annually, and inserting in lieu thereof the following: and shall give bond in an amount to be fixed and determined by the County Commissioners of Tift County, in no event to exceed the sum of $25,000.00, so that said section 11 as amended shall read as follows: Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that before entering upon the duties of his office the said county tax-commissioner shall take the oath now prescribed by law for tax-collectors and shall give bond in an amount to be fixed and determined by the county commissioners of said county, in no event to exceed the sum of $25,000.00, which bond shall be signed as surety by a bonding company legally authorized to do business in the State of Georgia, and the fee or cost for the suretyship on said bond shall be paid out of the funds of Tift County, Georgia, as part of the expense of county government.
Be it further enacted, that all laws and parts of laws in conflict herewith are hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to repeal an Act entitled An Act to create a board of commissioners of roads and revenues for Toombs County; prescribe their powers and duties, and for other purposes, approved August 17, 1912, and the Acts amendatory thereof.
law.p:
Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of the same, that the above-entitled Act to create a board
of commissioners of roads and revenues for Toombs County, prescribe their powers and duties, and for other purposes, approved August 17, 1912, and the Act amendatory thereof, be and the same are hereby repealed. Repeal of Act creating board effective Jan. 1, 1930.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted, that this Act shall not go into effect until January 1, 1930.
Sec. 3. Be it further enacted, that all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be and the same are hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to create a board of commissioners of roads and revenues in and for the County of Toombs; to provide for the election of commissioners who shall constitute said board; to prescribe the terms of office, their duties, fix their salaries, and for other purposes.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of the same, that a board of commissioners of roads and revenues in and for the County of Toombs, to consist of five persons, is hereby created. Said commissioners shall be qualified voters of said county and shall be bona fide residents of the commissioners' districts from which they are elected, which districts are defined in section 2 of this Act. Board created.

Sec. 2. Be it further enacted, that Toombs County shall be divided into five commissioners' districts to be constituted as follows, to wit: The first commissioners' district shall be composed of Vidalia, the 51st militia district, and Normantown, the 1715th militia district; the second commissioners' district shall be composed of Lyons, the 1536th militia district; the third commissioners' district
shall be composed of Cedar Crossing, the 43rd militia district, and McNabb, the 1521st militia district; the fourth commissioners' district shall be composed of Blue Ridge, the 1192nd militia district, and Ohoopee, the 1770th militia district; and the fifth commissioners' district shall be composed of Spring Head, the 39th militia district, and Sawdust, the 1403rd militia district. The commissioners shall have authority, by majority vote of said board, to attach any new district that may be created to any one of said districts. Districts described.

Sec. 3. Be it further enacted, that said board of county commissioners shall be composed of the following persons, to wit: J. F. Darby, of the first commissioners' district, Dan Odom of the second commissioners' district, J. S. Alexander of the third commissioners' district, T. B. McDilda of the fourth commissioners' district, and E. W. Clifton of the fifth commissioners' district, and each shall hold office until January 1, 1931, and their successors shall hold office for two years, and each shall take and subscribe the following oath: I do swear that I will well, truly and faithfully discharge the duties of commissioner of roads and revenues in and for the County of Toombs during my continuance in office according to law, to best of my knowledge and ability, without favor or affection to any person, firm, or corporation. So help me God. Commissioners named.Oath.

Sec. 4. Be it further enacted, that on the date that the general election is held in Toombs County for the election of State-House officials, beginning with the year 1930, and every two years thereafter there shall be held an election in the respective district hereinbefore named to fill the vacancies of said commissioners should a vacancy occur by death, resignation or otherwise, the other commissioners shall name his successor from the district in which he lives, and he shall hold office for the remainder of said term. Election.

Sec. 5. Be it further enacted, that said board of commissioners shall have original and exclusive jurisdiction and control over all roads, bridges, public works, buildings and
property of said county, and over the revenues of said county and over all the subject-matter enumerated and set forth in section 4796 of the Code of Georgia adopted August 15, 1910, and in paragraphs 1 to 9, inclusive, set out under said section of said Code, and also over the following matters, to wit: Examining and approving the bonds of all county officers except as otherwise provided by law, approving and directing the payment of all orders on the county treasury for the payment of public monies, supervising the tax-collector and tax-receiver's books, and allowing the insolvent list of said county, examine the tax-digest of said county for the correction of errors therein, and granting relief from double taxation where deemed advisable; establishing and maintaining a county chain-gang, and working said chain-gang on public roads, bridges, canals, drains, or public work of said county, to employ a county warden, and guards to buy necessary machinery, engines, tools, wagons, livestock, and other things necessary for carrying on any public work; borrowing money on the credit of the county, where the same can be lawfully borrowed, and executing notes, bonds, or vouchers, or other obligations in the county's name therefor; electing a janitor for the court-house, county physician, county attorney, clerk, or any other employee that may be needed to maintain the affairs of the county and their office; to fix their compensation, and make such rules and regulations as they may deem expedient. Jurisdiction and powers.

Sec. 6. Be it further enacted, that said commissioner shall receive annually two hundred forty ($240.00) dollars each as their compensation, except the chairman, who shall receive annually three hundred ($300.00) dollars, said amount to be paid quarterly out of the road fund of said County of Toombs, and said amount shall be in full for every service rendered by them for said county. Three of said commissioners shall constitute a quorum and must concur to pass any order, let any contract, pledge the county credit, grant, or allow any claim or charge against the county. Salaries.

Sec. 7. Be it further enacted, that said board shall have the right to elect a clerk, to be paid monthly out of the road fund at a salary not to exceed one hundred and fifty ($150.00) dollars per month, and he shall not receive from said county any other compensation for his services. Said clerk shall give good and solvent bond in the sum of five thousand ($5,000.00) dollars, payable to the commissioner of roads and revenues of Toombs County, Georgia, to be approved by said commissioners, conditioned for the faithful performance of his duties as clerk, and he may be removed at pleasure by majority vote of the board. He shall attend all meetings of the board, keep their minutes, and record all vouchers, and do and perform all duties required of him by the board. He shall issue no check or voucher unless countersigned by the chairman. Clerk's salary, bond, duties.

Sec. 8. Be it further enacted, that each commissioner shall give good and sufficient bond, payable to the ordinary of said county, in the sum of twenty-five hundred ($2,500.00) dollars, the same to be approved by the ordinary, conditioned for their faithful performance as commissioners. Bond.

Sec. 9. Be it further enacted, that the regular meeting of said commissioners shall be the second Monday in each month in the court-house of Toombs County, Georgia, and may adjourn from day to day, and may hold call sessions when necessary. Meetings.

Sec. 10. Be it further enacted, that any person desiring to run for commissioner of any road district of said county shall file with the clerk of said commissioners, ten days before the time of holding election, his intention in writing, and on failure to do so, his name shall not be placed on the ballot. The candidate running for commissioner shall only be voted on by voters living in said district. Notice of candidacy.

Sec. 11. Be it further enacted, that said board of commissioners shall be superintendents of roads in and for the County of Toombs, and each commissioner in his said district is especially charged of looking after the roads and bridges in his said district. Superintendents of roads.

Sec. 12. Be it further enacted, that while Toombs County maintain a chain-gang, and works convicts on its roads, said commissioners shall employ a convict-warden, whose duty it shall be to work said convicts on the roads and bridges of said county and perform all the duties required by law of a warden. Said commissioners shall fix his salary at not more than twenty-four hundred ($2,400.00) dollars per annum, and out of the amount so fixed he shall furnish his automobile, gas, and oil, and shall receive from said county no other compensation or emoluments for any services rendered said county. Chain-gang.Convict-warden; salary.

Sec. 13. Be it further enacted, that the commissioner from the Lyons or Second Commissioners' district shall be chairman of said board, and said commissioners shall at their regular meeting in January each year elect a vice-chairman, clerk, county physician, county attorney, and county warden, who shall hold office for one year only. Chairman and other officers.
Sec. 14. Be it further enacted, that said board of commissioners shall collect no commutation road-tax or require that work be done on the roads in lieu thereof. No road or commutation tax.

Sec. 15. Be it further enacted, that the convicts of said county shall be worked each year in each commissioners' district the number of days that the public-road mileage in said district bears to the mileage of the whole county less the State-aid roads, except, in an emergency caused by providential cause, said commissioners may disregard this section. Working days.
Sec. 16. Be it further enacted, that this law shall not go into effect until January 1, 1930. Effective Jan. 1, 1930.
Sec. 17. Be it further enacted, that all laws and parts of laws in conflict be and the same are hereby repealed.

law.shorttitle: TOOMBS COUNTY ROAD WORK ACT REPEALED.
law.fulltitle: An Act to repeal an Act to provide for the working of the public roads, and the building and repairing of bridges in the County of Toombs; to authorize the ordinary, county commissioners, or whoever may have charge of the county affairs of said county; to appoint a road superintendent of public roads and bridges, and overseers, and to fix their qualifications, compensations, and define their power and duties; to provide who shall be subject to road duty; and commutation-tax in lieu of work; and to provide for the punishment of defaulters and delinquent officers; to provide for levying a tax for road purposes; to authorize the proper authorities to purchase, hire, or rent all machinery, implements, stock, tools, and other things necessary for the working of said public road and bridges and repairing the same, and for other purposes, approved August 19, 1907, and the acts amendatory thereof.
law.p:
Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of the same, that the above-entitled Act to provide for the working of the public roads, and the building and repairing of bridges in the County of Toombs; to authorize the ordinary, county commissioners, or whoever may have charge of the county roads and bridges, and overseers, and to fix their qualifications, compensation, and define their powers and duties; to provide who shall be subject to road duty, and commutation-tax in lieu of work; to provide for the punishment of defaulters and delinquents officers; to provide for levying a tax for road purposes; to authorize the proper authorities to purchase, hire or rent all machinery, implements, stock, tools and other things necessary for the working of said public roads and bridges and repairing the same, and for other purposes, approved August 19, 1907,
and the Acts amendatory thereof, be and the same are hereby repealed. Repeal of Acts as to road work, etc.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted, that this law shall not go into effect until January 1, 1930.
Sec. 3. Be it further enacted, that all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.shorttitle: TOWNS COUNTY TERRITORY EXEMPT FROM FENCE LAW.
law.fulltitle: An Act to amend an Act approved August 15, 1927, entitled an Act to exempt the 918th, 990th and 1468th militia districts of Towns County, Georgia, from the operation of the provisions of section 2037, volume 1 of the Code of Georgia, in so far as relates to district-line fences and gates across public roads; to authorize the impounding stock in said districts, and their sale, and for other purposes, so as to provide so as to change the line of said territory from the top of Bell Mountain west to Bell Creek public road and thence northwest to the line between the States of Georgia and North Carolina, and for other purposes.
law.p:
Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of same, that from and after the passage of this Act the Act approved August 15, 1927, exempting the 918th, 990th, and 1468th militia districts from the maintenance of district fences and gates across public roads therein, be and the same is hereby amended so as to change the territory embraced in said exemption by the following change in the line of said territory, to wit: Beginning on the district line on top of Bell Mountain and running north with original
lines between lots of land numbers 44, 45, 70, and 71 to Bell Creek public road; thence with said road a north-east course to the line between the States of Georgia and North Carolina. Change of exempt territory.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that all laws and parts of laws in conflict with the provisions of this Act be and the same are hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to amend an Act entitled Troup County Tax-Commissioner, the same being the Act creating the office of Tax-Commissioner of Troup County, approved August 20, 1927, and found in Georgia Laws for 1927, page 695.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of the same, that the Act of the General Assembly of Georgia, entitled Troup County Tax Commissioner, approved August 20, 1927, and found in Georgia Laws for 1927, page 695, be and the same is hereby amended as follows:

Section 7 of said Act is amended by striking from said Act in subsection (a), in the last sentence of said section, the word not, and inserting in place of said word the word now, so that said sentence when amended shall read And be conditioned as bonds of tax-collectors for State taxes are now conditioned. Condition of bond.
Section 7, subsection (a), of said Act shall be further amended by adding the following sentence: The premium on said bond is to be paid by Troup County. Premium of bond.

Section 7, subsection (b), of said Act shall be amended by adding the following sentence: The premium on said bond is to be paid by the board of commissioners of roads and revenues of Troup County. Same.

Said Section 7 of said Act when amended shall read as follows: Section 7. Said tax-commissioner, whether elected or appointed, before entering on the duties of his office, beside the oath required of all civil officers, shall take and subscribe the following oath: I swear that I will truly and faithfully perform the duties of county tax-commissioner of Troup County, Georgia, that is to say, all duties heretofore required and prescribed for tax-receivers and tax-collector, and such other duties as might be required by law; that I will not receive any return but on oath or affirmation; that I will search out and make a true return of all defaulters, polls, professions, and all taxable property not returned; that I will account for and pay over all taxes collected by me, as required by law, and will, to the best of my ability, carry out all of the requirements made upon me by law; so help me, God. To read.

And said tax-commissioner shall also at the same time give bonds and security as follows: (a) Bond and security, payable to his Excellency the Governor and his successors in office, in a sum equal to one half of the State tax estimated to be due from Troup County for the year for which said officer is required to give bond, to be filled up by the Comptroller-General before being sent out to the county from the Executive Office, and to be conditioned as bonds of tax-collectors for State taxes are now conditioned. The premium is to be paid by Troup County. (b) Bond and security payable to the board of commissioners of roads and revenues of Troup County, Georgia, conditioned for the faithful performance of his duties as such tax-commissioner, in a sum to be fixed by said board of commissioners, which said bond must be filed with and approved by said board of commissioners, and recorded on the records of said board. The premium on said bond is to be paid by Troup
County. The security on both of said bonds to be a reliable bonding company. If said tax-commissioner, whether elected or appointed, shall fail or neglect to give and file said bonds, as above required, within ten (10) days from the time of beginning the discharge of the duties of his office, said board of commissioners of roads and revenues of Troup County shall declare a vacancy in said office, which vacancy shall be filled in the manner above provided.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted, that all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this be and the same are hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to determine by ballot the number comprising the board of roads and revenues of Twiggs County, Georgia, the term of office of said board, compensation of said board, duties of said board; provision of the clerk of said board, his duties, compensation, and other purposes.
law.p:
Section 1. By it enacted by the General Assembly of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of the same as follows: That it be provided that the voters of Twiggs County, Georgia, be allowed to determine by ballot at the next regular primary election for board of roads and revenues the number comprising such board, whether a one-man system, a three-man system, or a five-man system of roads and revenues; that the tickets used in said election shall have full wording and instruction on said question of the change of the system of roads and revenues in Twiggs County. And it is hereby provided that a majority ballot cast will determine in favor of a one-man board or a three-man board or a five-man board. Provided further that in said election if a one-man commissioner system is declared,
the candidate receiving the highest number of votes shall be declared the nominee for the said one-man commission of roads and revenues; or if a three-man board system is declared by said primary election, that the three men receiving the highest number of votes respectively shall constitute the nominees of said board of roads and revenues; provided that if a five-man board system is declared, that the five men receiving the highest number of votes respectively shall be declared the nominees of the said board. Provided further that if either a three or a five-man system of roads and revenues is declared, that the same law now in effect governing roads and revenues of Twiggs County shall remain in full force and effect, but provided further that if a one-man commission system is declared, the following sections shall be and are hereby enacted by the authority of the General Assembly: Referendum.

Section 1-A. That the term of office of commissioner of roads and revenues shall be for a term of four (4) years, and until his successor is elected and qualified, the first term under the provision of this Act beginning on the first day of January, 1931, and that an election shall be held every four years at the same time and places and under the same rules and regulations as the election of county officers for Twiggs County, Georgia, is held, for the election of a commissioner of roads and revenues for the succeeding term of four years. Commissioner's term of office.

Sec. 2. That in the event a vacancy occurs in the office of commissioner of roads and revenues by death, resignation, removal, or otherwise, the vacancy shall be filled, until a successor is elected and qualified, by the ordinary of Twiggs County, Georgia. The selection by said ordinary of such person to fill said vacancy shall be made without regard to political considerations, and purely on account of the fitness of the person so selected to serve; the person thus selected to serve shall so serve until his successor is elected and qualified. Vacancy.

Sec. 3. That it shall be the duty of said ordinary of Twiggs County Georgia, upon a vacancy occurring in the office of commissioner of roads and revenues, to call an election to be held in the county at the regular voting precincts, and as elections are held for county officers and under the same rules and regulations, to elect a commissioner of roads and revenues to fill the vacancy, the election to be held not earlier than thirty days (30) after the vacancy occurs. The ordinary shall have notice of such elections published twice in the newspaper in the said county in which sheriff's sales are published. Provided that in the event a vacancy in the office of commissioner of roads and revenues should occur within six months of the next succeeding general election for the election of county officers in said county, no special election shall be called, but the commissioner appointed by the ordinary in the manner pointed out and provided in Section 4 of this Act shall serve until said general election, at which time a commissioner shall be elected. And the said Commissioner appointed by the ordinary shall fill out the unexpired term of the said commissioner vacating by death, removal, or otherwise, until the beginning of the next regular term. Election.

Sec. 4. That, except as otherwise provided in this Act, the commissioner of roads and revenues of said County of Twiggs shall have such control of the county affairs generally as is now conferred upon the county board of commissioners of said county, and to have and exercise all of the powers as would be vested in the ordinary of Twiggs County, Georgia, when sitting for county purposes, in the absence of this Act or in the absence of a county board of commissioners of roads and revenues. Said commissioner of roads and revenues shall have exclusive jurisdiction and control over the following matters, to wit: In directing and controlling all of the property of the county as he may deem expedient and to the best interest of the county, and in accordance with the laws of the State; in levying taxes in accordance with the laws of this State; in establishing, changing, and abolishing roads, bridges, and ferries, according
to law; in establishing, changing, and abolishing election precincts and militia districts; in supervising the tax-collector's and tax-receiver's books, in allowing the insolvent list of the County of Twiggs; in allowing and settling all charges, claims, and demands against the said County of Twiggs; in examining and auditing all claims and accounts of officers having the care, keeping, and collection or disbursing any money belonging to the County of Twiggs or appropriated for its use and benefit, and in bringing all such officers to settlement; in making rules and regulations for the promotion of public health; in electing or appointing all minor officers of said county where an election is not otherwise provided by law or the provisions of this Act; and to have and exercise control and management over the convicts of said county, according to law; to have and to exercise control and management over all employees of said county engaged in the construction, building, and maintenance of the public roads of said county, and to exercise control, management, and supervision of the county road machinery and road equipment. Jurisdiction and powers.

Sec. 5. The commissioner of roads and revenues shall appoint a clerk, who shall be a person of good moral character and a person of good business ability and able to keep correct books, and whose compensation shall not be less than fifty dollars ($50.00) nor more than eighty-five dollars ($85.00), and shall be hired for such term or time as said commissioner of roads and revenues sees fit and proper; said salary to be paid out of the funds of said county. It shall be the duty of said clerk to keep the minutes and records of all proceedings of said commissioners, and to discharge such other and further duties in connection with said office as said commissioner may require. It shall be the duty of the said clerk to be the bookkeeper for said commissioner, and he shall do such other clerical work as shall be necessary in carrying on the work of said office. Said clerk shall attend all hearings or meetings of the said commissioner, and keep a full, clear and complete report of said office, to record all proceedings, to keep on file and preserve
all papers relating to said office. Said clerk shall also keep a book known as the Property Book, and a book to be known as the Book of Commutation Taxpayers of said county, all of which shall be open to public inspection at any time. Said clerk shall also keep a book known as the Record of County Vouchers, and a book commonly known as the County Cash Book; all of which shall be open at all times to public inspection. The said clerk, before entering upon the discharge of his said duties, shall take a similar oath to that herein prescribed for the commissioner of roads and revenues, which shall be recorded upon the minutes kept by said commissioner, and the said clerk shall furthermore, before entering upon the discharge of his said duties of said office, give bond and good security in some approved surety company, the premium upon said bond to be paid out of the county treasury of Twiggs County, said bond to be in the penal sum of three thousand dollars (3,000.00), to be approved by the ordinary of said county, payable to the commissioner of roads and revenues of said county and his successor in office; which said bond when so executed and approved shall be by the ordinary of said County of Twiggs recorded in his record of official bonds kept by him in his said office. Clerk; salary, duties, oath, bond.

Sec. 6. It shall be the duty of the commissioner of roads and revenues of Twiggs County, Georgia, to plan, lay out, superintend, and construct all public roads and bridges; and to this end he is authorized to procure the services of competent engineers and experts in any project, where the same may be necessary in his judgment; provided that this Act shall not be construed so as to prevent the contracting of such improvements after a compliance with the laws applicable to such cases. In the laying out and construction of roads and bridges of the county, the commissioner shall be controlled by the general best interest of the county, and shall far as practicable work out a system of rotating the road machinery and equipment of said county among the different roads of the different militia districts of said county shall receive their proportionate share of work; it
being the spirit and purpose and intent of this said paragraph of this Act to maintain a just and fair and equitable distribution of road work annually to all of the districts of said county. Roads and bridges.

Sec. 7. The commissioner of roads and revenues shall have the right and power to purchase such provisions, supplies, machinery, stock, equipment, repairs for machinery, and all necessary articles, equipment, repairs for machinery, and all necessary articles, equipment, and things of all classes and description, kinds, and character necessary and proper for the carrying out of the work or business of the county; but it shall be unlawful and a misdemeanor for him to have any financial interest in any article so purchased, or in any contract or project entered into by him for said county. Purchases.

Sec. 8. All payments for provisions, supplies, machinery, stock, equipment, labor, contract, or otherwise, shall be by voucher drawn by the clerk and signed by the commissioner, and each voucher shall have written or printed thereon its numerical number, to whom payable, for what payable, the amount thereof, and upon what fund drawing; and an accurate stup of every voucher shall be kept in regular consecutive order, correct by dates, for every purchase or expenditures of commissioner, which shall be preserved in permanent form and subject to inspection at all times by a person interested. Payments.

Sec. 9. All paid vouchers shall be preserved and arranged and kept by the clerk in consecutive order, those of each month kept in separate packages, and shall present the same to the grand jury of the county when they shall require it in pursuance of Section 15 of this Act. Vouchers.

Sec. 10. It shall be the duty of the commissioner of roads and revenues to keep an office at the court-house in Twiggs County for himself and his clerk. It shall be the duty of the clerk to keep the office open each working day of the week during reasonable office hours, and shall record all information and complaints pertaining to county matters,
for the information of the commissioner. It is further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that the said commissioner, together with his said clerk, shall be in his office on the first Tuesday in each and every month, for the transaction of the public interests of the county, for the hearing of applications and complaints, and for such other purposes as may come legitimately within his jurisdiction. He may by special appointment fix and have other days in his office for such purposes when the pressure of business requires it; but nothing herein shall be construed to dispense with the regular day fixed on the first Tuesday in each month. It shall be his duty to give his entire time to the personal supervision and direction of the county affairs. Office hours, etc.

Sec. 11. That the commissioner of roads and revenues of said County of Twiggs, before entering upon the duties of his said office, shall take oath before the ordinary of said County of Twiggs to faithfully, fairly, and impartially discharge all the duties devolving upon him as commissioner of said County of Twiggs, and shall give bond with some good and solvent surety company, suable in said county, as surety, in the sum of twenty thousand dollars ($20,000.00), payable to the ordinary of Twiggs County, Georgia, and his successors in office, for the use and benefit of Twiggs County, conditioned for the faithful discharge of all the duties of his office, and for the faithful accounting of all monies coming into his hands, belonging to said county; and provided that the premium on the said bond be paid out of the county treasury; said bond to be approved by the ordinary of Twiggs County, Georgia, and the said bond when so executed and approved shall be by the ordinary of said county recorded in his record of official bonds kept by him in his office. Bond of commissioner.

Sec. 12. Said commissioner of roads and revenues of said county shall receive as compensation for his said services the sum of two hundred ($200.00) dollars per month, payable out of the county treasury on the first Tuesday in each and every month. Salary of commissioner.

Sec. 13. It shall be the duty of the commissioner of roads and revenues of said county to provide suitable permanent books wherein a record shall be kept of his Acts, all contracts and purchases, all permanent improvements, repairs, or additions, all expenses and expenditures, together with the dates and amounts, and for what paid, the persons to whom paid, and a complete detailed account of every transation where any money is paid or contracted to be paid out of the county funds. It shall be the duty of said commissioner to make daily reports of such matters, and it shall be the duty of the clerk to accurately enter upon the books of said office the full and complete details of every transaction in chronological order. It is further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that each county warrant issued in payment of any bill, obligation, account, or debt of said county shall not be a valid and binding order on the treasury of said county unless countersigned by the clerk of said commissioner when signed by the said commissioner. Records, reports.

Sec. 14. It shall be the duty of the grand jury, at the first regular session thereof each year, to provide for a competent auditor to audit the books and accounts of the commissioner of roads and revenues and his said clerk, and to make an exhaustive report of his findings, and to file the same with the clerk of the superior court of Twiggs County, Georgia, whose duty it shall be to preserve the original report until the meeting of the next regular grand jury thereafter, when the same shall be delivered to the foreman of the grand jury; and it shall be the duty of the grand jury, with the assistance of the solicitor-general, to examine the report and make such recommendations as may seem proper, and it shall have power and authority to summon the commissioner or the clerk, or both, and other witnesses, with all books and records, paid vouchers, and other evidence, for the purpose of examination, in order to make a thorough examination into the administration of the commissioner's office. This power and duty of the grand jury shall not be conditioned upon a suspicion of wrong-doing
or political reasons, but is intended to insure a thorough understanding of the management of the county affairs at all times. The cost of the audit and its publication shall be paid out of the county treasury of said county. It shall be the further duty of the said grand jury aforesaid, upon the same terms and conditions as aforesaid, to also have a similar audit made of the books and accounts of the tax-collector, tax-receiver, county depository, sheriff's office, and superintendent of public schools. The said auditor's report covering each and all of the said offices shall, after inspection by the grand jury, be returned to the clerk of Twiggs superior court, and shall be filed and preserved by him. Audit

Sec. 15. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that the commissioner of roads and revenues and the clerk, or both, or either, shall be subject to impeachment for incompetency or malfeasance in office, in the same manner as county officers are subject to impeachment. Impeachment.

Sec. 16. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that it shall be the duty of the clerk of said commissioner of roads and revenues to draw vouchers on the county treasury or county depository for all bills approved by the commissioner of roads and revenues, and to file and preserve all bills for which vouchers are drawn, arranging them in regular sequence, according to date; and no voucher shall be drawn except for written bills or accounts properly approved by the commissioner. Vouchers.

Sec. 17. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that the said commissioner of roads and revenues is hereby authorized and empowered to retain and employ a competent attorney at law, and such commissioner is authorized to pay such attorney a retainer fee of not exceeding two hundred and fifty ($250.00) dollars per annum, to be paid monthly out of the county funds of Twiggs County, and such attorney shall receive such other compensation as may be agreed upon by him and said commissioner. It shall be the duty of said county attorney to represent the County of Twiggs in all legal matters in which said county
may be interested, and he shall be the legal adviser of said commissioner, and shall attend the said commissioner's meeting when requested. Attorney; compensation.

Sec. 18. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that the said commissioner of roads and revenues is hereby further authorized and empowered to employ a competent physician for the purpose of giving medical attention and aid to the county jail prisoners, paupers of the county, convicts of the county, any other matter requiring his services as a county physician; and the said commissioner of roads and revenues shall have the right and authority to fix his compensation. Physician; compensation.

Sec. 19. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that in the event the grand jury of the said County of Twiggs during any year shall fail, refuse, or neglect to have the books and affairs of the offices of tax-collector, tax-receiver, sheriff, and superintendent of public schools audited and examined by some certified public accountant of this State, then and in that event it shall be the duty of said commissioner of roads and revenues to have the said audit of said offices made by some certified public auditor of this State, upon the same terms and conditions and subject to the same rules and regulations as is set out in section 19 of this Act. Audit.

Sec. 20. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that said commissioner, at the end of each quarter of the year, shall make up an itemized statement showing all amounts collected and expended on behalf of the county during the quarter. Said statement shall show the balance of cash on hand at the beginning of the quarter and at the end of the quarter. Said statement shall also show the amount of outstanding indebtedness of the county and how the same represented, whether open account, note, or warrant. He shall verify the said statement as follows: I, , commissioner of roads and revenues of Twiggs County, Georgia, do solemnly swear that the above is a full and true statement of the monetary
transactions of my office for the quarter ending , as well as showing the outstanding indebtedness of said county; that I have not received any rebate, commission, or drawback, nor have I personally profited or known of any illegal profit to any one whomsoever through any transaction of my office, so help me, God. Signed Sworn to and subscribed before me this the....day of....., 19..... Said statement shall be published in the official organ of the county, provided the commissioner can arrange for its publication at a satisfactory price, not to exceed in any event $1.00 per one hundred words. If the commissioner cannot obtain the publication of said account or statement at a satisfactory price by the official newspaper of the county, or some other newspaper with a general circulation in the county, then he shall erect a bulletin board in the rotunda of the county court-house and post such account or statement thereon. Financial statement.Oath to statement.Publication.

Sec. 21. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that said commissioner of roads and revenues of said County of Twiggs shall cause the convict gang of said county, or free labor if used, to work all continuations of public roads through the various incorporated towns and municipalities of said County of Twiggs. Road work.

Sec. 22. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that if a one-man system is declared by a majority of the voters and the commissioner of roads and revenues for said County of Twiggs shall have been elected and qualified, that after the 31st day of December, nineteen thirty, all Acts creating and relating to the board of roads and revenues of Twiggs County, and all amendatory Acts thereof, said Acts being approved respectively December 5, 1898, August 14, 1903, August 10, 1915, August 18, 1917, August 12, 1920, and July 27, 1923, shall be repealed, and this Act shall constitute the laws governing said office of commissioner of roads and revenues in and for said County of Twiggs, effective after the thirty-first day of December; provided further that a majority vote does not declare for
a one-man board, but for a three-man board system or for a five-man board system, then the same laws now governing the boards of roads and revenues, and the clerk for same shall govern as to salaries, duties, and regulations. Act effective when.
Sec. 23. Be it further enacted that all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be and the same are hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to amend the Act approved August 6, 1920, changing the terms of office of the Commissioners of Roads and Revenues of Upson County; to fix the terms of office of the commissioners elected under this Act; to provide when said commissioners shall be elected; to provide who shall be chairman of said commissioners; to fix the compensation of the chairman and the other commissioners; to repeal any part of said Act of 1920 that is in conflict with this Act, and for other purposes.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of the same, that from and after the passage of this Act that the terms of office of the present Commissioners of Roads and Revenues of Upson County shall expire as follows: The term of the commissioner who is now serving from the First shall expire on January 1, 1933; the term of the commissioner who is now serving from the Second District shall expire on January 1, 1931; the term of the commissioner who is now serving from the Third District shall expire on January 1, 1932. Terms of office.

Sec. 2. Be it further enacted, that each year after the passage of this Act, at the regular time for holding elections for county officers, there shall be elected from the district
from which the vacancy will next occur one commissioner whose term of office shall be three years. Elections.
Sec. 3. Be it further enacted, that the commissioner elected from the Second District shall always be the chairman of the board. Chairman.

Sec. 4. Be it further enacted, that from and after January 1, 1930, the chairman of the board shall receive the sum of seventy-five dollars per month and the other two commissioners shall receive the sum of fifty dollars per month each, and this shall be all the compensation that each member of the commissioners shall receive for their services. Salaries of chairman and commissioners.
Sec. 5. Be it further enacted, that so much of the Act approved August 6, 1920, that is in conflict with this Act be and the same is hereby repealed. Repeal of conflicting law.

law.fulltitle: An Act to repeal the Act of 1917, pages 415-21, approved August 14, 1917, entitled An Act to establish for the County of Walton a board of commissioners of roads and revenues; to prescribe the powers and duties of said board; to fix the terms of such officers and their compensation, and for other purposes, and all Acts amendatory to the same, and for other purposes.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, that the Act of 1917, pages 415 to 421, inclusive, and approved the 14th day of August, 1917, entitled An Act to establish for the County of Walton a board of commissioners of roads and revenues; to prescribe the powers and duties of said board; to fix the terms of such officers and their compensation, and for other purposes, and all Acts amendatory to the same be and the same are hereby repealed. Repeal of Act establishing board.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted, that this Act shall take effect on the 1st day of January, 1930. Effective Jan. 1, 1930.

Sec. 3. Be it further enacted, that immediately after the election of a board of commissioners for said county as may be provided by law and the receipt of their commissions from the Governor and their taking the oath of office required, the present board of commissioners or those serving under the said Act of 1917, shall deliver to said commissioners as may be so elected and sworn in office, the office and keys to the same, and any and all the books, files, papers, memoranda, office fixtures as well as all the machinery, real estate, convicts; and any and all other property in their possession and control, as commissioners, belonging to the County of Walton or to which the county shall have the right of possession. Surrender of property.
Sec. 4. Be it further enacted, that any and all laws in conflict herewith be and the same are hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to create a board of commissioners of roads and revenues for the County of Walton, State of Georgia; to provide for the election of members of said board; to prescribe their powers, duties, qualifications and compensation; to provide for the employment or appointment of a clerk for said board; to fix his compensation; to provide for the calling and holding of an election by the qualified voters of said county for said commissioners; to repeal all laws in conflict with this Act, and for other purposes.
law.p:
Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of the same that a board of commissioners of roads and revenues
for the County of Walton is hereby created. Said board shall consist of three residents of said county and shall be qualified voters for members of the General Assembly in said county, and possess such other qualifications as may be hereinafter prescribed; and they shall be elected by the qualified voters of said county at the time and in the manner as hereinafter provided. Board created.Qualifications of members.

Sec. 2. The terms of office shall be for said commissioners for a period of four years and until their successors are elected and qualified; but for the first term it shall be from the time of their election, as herein prescribed, until the next regular election in the year 1932. All elections under this Act, except the first one, as may be necessary, shall be held at the same time and places, and under the same rules and regulations as primary and general elections are held for members of the General Assembly of Georgia. The first election hereunder shall be held on November 5, 1929, as hereinafter prescribed. It shall not be necessary to have a primary election for the first term. The commissioners so elected shall enter upon the discharge of their duties as such commissioners on January 1, 1930, as soon as they may be elected and give their bonds and take the oath of office, as herein required. Terms of office.Elections.

Sec. 3. The board of commissioners under the Act of 1917, pages 415 to 421, inclusive, shall deliver to their successors who may be elected under this Act any and all books, documents, and other papers, and any and all property belonging to the county, which they may have in their possession and control, and which may have been delivered to them by the board of commissioners of roads and revenues in and for said county, or heretofore by the ordinary of said County of Walton. And said commissioners shall prepare and file and record in their office a complete list of such books and property so delivered. Transfer of records, etc., by old board.

Sec. 4. The members of said board of commissioners, before entering upon their duties, shall take an oath before the ordinary of said county to faithfully discharge all the
duties of said office with honesty and fidelity, and free from any and all graft, and according to the laws and the constitution of the State of Georgia, which oath shall be subscribed by them upon the minutes of their proceedings. Oath.

Sec. 5. Any vacancy in said office that may occur shall be filled by appointment by the remaining commissioners. The person appointed shall hold office only for the unexpired term under said appointment. Vacancy.

Sec. 6. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that said board of commissioners shall hold a regular meeting on the second Monday in each month at the court-house of the City of Monroe; but they may hold a special meeting at any time called by a majority of said board, and may adjourn regular meeting from day to day if necessary. At all such meetings the chairman shall preside, if present, and on all questions that may be disposed of there shall be a concurrence of two of the commissioners; there shall be a yea and nay vote on all important matters, and the vote recorded on the minutes. Meetings.

Sec. 7. The commissioners shall elect some competent person as clerk and fix his salary not to exceed fifty dollars per month, said clerk not to be related to either of said commissioners within the third degree of consanguinity of affinity. Said clerk shall be required to take and subscribe to an oath to honestly and faithfully discharge the duties of his office, and shall also be required to give a good solvent bond to be approved by a majority of said commissioners in the sum of one thousand dollars, payable to the ordinary of said county. The board shall have the right to discharge said clerk at any time and elect a successor. It shall be the duty of said clerk to keep a book of inventory of all county property including road machinery, live stock, chain-gang outfits, road-work tools, and every other kind and class of property belonging to said county, with a fair valuation of the same, where located, in whose custody and in what condition; and he shall carefully revise such inventory each year. He shall also attend all sessions of the board and
shall keep an accurate record of the actings and doings of said board in a well-bound book to be provided at the expense of the county; and said clerk shall keep such other books and records as may be necessary, or as the board may want, and shall perform generally all and singular the Acts and duties necessary to be performed by him as such clerk. Clerk; salary, duties.

Sec. 8. Be it further enacted, that in the election provided for in this Act, and in the regular elections thereafter, the voters shall have written or printed on their ballots: 1. The names of all the candidates for chairman, under the heading, For Chairman of the Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues, and the voter shall strike all except the one of his choice for chairman. And 2. Following the names of the candidates for chairman the names of all the candidates for the two other places as members of the board shall be written or printed, under the heading, For the two board members' other than the chairman, and the voter shall strike all except the two other members of his choice for commissioners. To be eligible, the candidate for either place must be a freeholder and at least twenty-five years old, and qualified to vote for members of the General Assembly. The election returns shall be made to the ordinary of the county, who shall consolidate the same and make certificate to the Governor of the State, showing the results of said election, and the Governor shall issue commission accordingly to the successful candidates for the terms as specified by the ordinary. Elections of commissioners.Form of ballots.Qualifications.

Sec. 9. The board hereby established shall have jurisdiction over and control of all county matters, such as public roads, bridges, the working of convicts, county finances, the levying and collecting of taxes for county purposes, the management, controlover, and disbursing of county funds, the erection and maintenance of public buildings, the supervision over and control of and exclusive jurisdiction over and in all matters wherein jurisdiction is now vested in ordinaries in this State in counties where there exists no board of roads and revenues, in regard to county matters;
and so far as the same relates to all other matters over which the Inferior Court had jurisdiction at the time it was abolished, except lunacy cases. And said board shall constitute a court for the trial of road defulters; and shall have power and authority to summons witnesses, to punish for contempt, by fine or imprisonment, in same manner as ordinaries where there is no board of commissioners created. The sheriff or his deputy may be required to attend on a court session, to serve all papers at his usual fee-bill compensation. Jurisdiction and powers of board.

Sec. 10. Said board may make such rules and regulations as it may deem advisable for its own government, that of the clerk, and other employees, not inconsistent with the laws of this State or this Act. Said board shall keep correct minutes of its official Acts and doings in a minute-book kept for such purpose; a book of receipts and disbursements, a general ledger and a warrant book, a record of all sales of any property of the county. Said board shall also keep on file all paid warrants and vouchers and other papers necessary to show a complete record of all the transactions of said county. Records.

Sec. 11. Be it further enacted, that there is not now and there shall not be under this Act the office of county attorney. It shall be the duty of the solicitor-general of the circuit in which said County of Walton may be to advise the board as to the law or any litigation, and to represent said board in any case in court, when called on by the board, for which he shall make no charge, said solicitor-general now receiving $5,000.00 for only three counties, with a city court in Clarke and a county court in Oconee. But in the event there should be a city court established in the County of Walton, then the solicitor of such court shall represent the county in all litigation and counsel to the board with the solicitor-general of the circuit court. Solicitor to act as attorney for board. See Sections 19, 24, 25.

Sec. 12. Be it further enacted by said authority, that it shall be the duty of said board to work and keep in good repair all the public roads of said county, not kept up by the Highway
Board of the State, and to work and repair all the streets in the towns, cities and villages of said county which are continuations of the public roads through said towns, villages, and cities of said county. Road work.

Sec. 13. Be it further enacted, that said board shall publish semi-annual reports within fifteen days from the expiration of each six calendar months, once in the official newspaper published in said county (and in another newspaper published in said county, if deemed advisable by the commissioners), a full and complete statement of the finances of said county during the preceding half year, and showing all receipts and from what source derived, and all disbursements and for what purposes paid out, and such reports shall not be mere ledger balances, but shall be made in such manner and form as to plainly show the revenues of the county, as well as the cost of the county government, in each and every branch. Financial statements.

Sec. 14. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that the chairman of said board elected shall receive as his compensation the sum of eighteen hundred dollars per annum, payable monthly out of the county funds on his own warrant signed also by the clerk of said board. The two other members of said board shall each receive five dollars per day for each day of attendance on the meetings or sessions of the board, not to exceed two hundred dollars per annu, however, for each of said members. The chairman shall give his whole time and attention to the business of said county under this Act and the other laws of the State in regard to roads and revenues and county matters, keeping his office in the court-house in the City of Monroe, and he is hereby empowered with all the powers and duties now prescribed for the chairman of the board of commissioners under the Act of 1917, page 415, especially the first part of Section 5, page 417 and first six lines of page 418, that are not changes or in conflict with the other portions of this Act. Salaries of chairman and commissioners.Duties of chairman.

Sec. 15. Be it further enacted, that all of said commissioners, to be eligible, must also be freeholders, in addition to the other qualifications herein set forth; the chairman shall give bond in the sum of five thousand dollars, with good security, payable to the ordinary of said County of Walton, for the faithful discharge of his duties under this Act and any and all amendments to the same, and each of the other members shall give bond in the same manner in the sum of one thousand dollars each; if said bonds shall be made by a reliable bonding company, the cost of the same shall be paid out of the county funds; this is also applicable to the bond of the clerk. Qualifications and bond of commissioners.Cost of bonds.

Sec. 16. Be it further enacted, that all warrants shall be signed by the clerk as well as the chairman; that all contracts exceeding or as much as one hundred dollars shall be submitted to the other members of the board by mail or telephone, and approved by such other member or members of the board at the next regular meeting, or the dissent of such member not approving of the same recorded on the minutes by the clerk. Warrants.

Sec. 17. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that the election for said commissioners, consisting of a chairman and two others, is hereby called to take place in the County of Walton on the 5th day of next November, 1929, and the same shall be held as other elections for members of the General Assembly or county officers are or may be held. Any citizen of said county who shall be qualified to vote for members of the General Assembly shall be qualified to vote for said commissioners, and the managers of said election shall make their returns to the ordinary, who shall consolidate the votes and declare the result and certify the same to the Governor. Election of commissioners.

Sec. 18. Be it further enacted, that the candidate receiving the highest vote as chairman shall be elected as commissioner and as chairman of said board of commissioners and the two other candidates who shall receive the highest votes respectively shall be elected as the other two members of said board of commissioners, and the three shall so serve. Election of chairman.

Sec. 19. Be it further enacted, that said board shall be a body corporate and be entitled to sue and be sued, and may have the authority to employ additional counsel if necessary, but the same shall require a unanimous vote of said commissioners. Corporate powers.

Sec. 20. Be it further enacted, that said board shall have authority to quit working convicts and contract with any person or persons or corporation for the building of bridges or roads, if considered for the best interests of the county and the taxpayers; they shall endeavor to get the county out of debt and reduce taxes, instead of increasing the indebtedness and taxation. Authority as to road and bridge contracts.Reduction of indebtedness.

Sec. 21. Be it further enacted, that it shall be the duty of said board of commissioners to have all the public roads in said county, except the highways which are kept up by the State Highway Department, well worked, repaired, and improved. Road work.

Sec. 22. Be it further enacted, that said board shall have authority to select a well-qualified superintendent of roads, fix his compensation, and shall require such bond as they may consider best, if not fixed by law, for the faithful discharge of his duties under their direction, and the board in cooperation with the State prison commissioners shall have the right to discharge such superintendent and warden for any neglect of duty. Said board shall also have authority to hire all guards over convicts, and fix their compensation, and discharge any of them for neglect of duty. Superintendent of roads.Convict guards.

Sec. 23. Be it further enacted, that if any part of this Act should be held illegal or contrary to the constitution or any general law, the remainder of said Act shall remain binding and of full effect. Invalidity of part of Act not invalidate remainder.

Sec. 24. Be it further enacted, that it is not the intention under this Act to have any such officer as a county attorney, and if the service of any attorney shall be required, the contract of employment must be by unanimous vote, both as to person and the amount of fee, and all proceedings in this matter shall be recorded on the minutes. Attorney. See Sections 11, 19, 25.
Sec. 25. Be it further enacted, that the said board shall not have authority to contract for services to be rendered by lawyers beyond the terms of said commissioners.
Sec. 26. Be it further enacted, that any and all laws in conflict with this Act be and the same are hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to amend an act to create the office of commissioner of roads and revenues of the County of Ware, approved August 16, 1915, as subsequently amended; to fix the salary of the said commissioner, to strike therefrom a portion of sections nine and ten of said Act, and to strike all of sections fourteen and fifteen of said Act, relating to the collection of the commutation or road tax; to prescribe the qualifications and fix the salary of the county attorney; and for other purposes.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of the same, that from and after the passage of this Act the Act creating the office of commissioner of roads and revenues of the County of Ware, which Act was approved August 16, 1915, together with the several amendments thereto, be and the same are hereby amended as follows:
Sec. 2. The salary of said commissioner is hereby fixed at thirty-six hundred ($3600.00) dollars per annum, payable monthly out of the general funds of the said county. Salary of commissioner.

Sec. 3. Section nine of said Act is hereby amended by striking therefrom the following words, following the words in the best manner in the latter portion of said section nine: and so far as practical, he shall supply each year the
amount of money collected in each and every militia district in said county from the commutation tax to the work and repair of the public roads in that particular district from which it was collected. The work may be done by that part of the road force known as the repair force, or it may be done by contract with citizens along or near said road in said districts. Section nine of said Act shall then read, as amended, as follows: Be it further enacted, that it shall be the duty of said commissioner, acting with the clerk and ordinary, to supply, from the ad valorem tax for roads, such machinery, mule, and gasoline power and other equipment as shall be necessary to work the public roads of said county in a manner in keeping with the revenue of said county, and serving the greatest number of people in the best manner. Road work; machinery, etc.

Sec. 4. Section ten of said Act is hereby amended by striking therefrom the following words, following the words constructed mileage in the latter portion of said section ten: And a part of the commutation road-tax may thereafter be used for such purposes, if it shall prove more effective than the yearly repair road work as hereinbefore specified. Section ten of said Act shall then read as follows: Be it further enacted, that the first permanent road work under this Act shall be in that section or sections where it will do the greatest good to the greatest number, and this policy shall continue in all permanent road work; and the permanent work shall be done in all instances as far as practical by the working forces in said county other than of the repair force. The commissioner shall apply the most efficient means of keeping in a state of continuous repair all such permanently constructed mileage. Distribution of road work.Working force.
Sec. 5. All of section fourteen of said Act is hereby stricken therefrom. Sections 14 and 15 of Act of 1915 stricken.
Sec. 6. All of section fifteen of said Act is hereby stricken therefrom.

Sec. 7. The commissioner of roads and revenues shall work the road forces of said County of Ware within the
incorporate limits of the City of Waycross at least two months out of each year, in the spring months of each year, employing them, under his supervision and direction, in doing such work on the streets, lans, canals, etc., of said city as the officials of the said city shall request him to perform within said period of two months. Work in City of Waycross.
Sec. 8. Be it further enacted that all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be and the same are hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to create a board of county commissioners of roads and revenues for the County of White; to provide for the election and creation of said board; to provide and name the duties thereof; to provide for the election of their successors; to provide for the terms of office; to provide for a clerk for said board; to provide for the appointment of a road supervisor or a road engineer; for compensation thereof; to provide for the election of an attorney for said board and for his compensation, and how paid; to provide for filling vacancies on said board; and for other purposes.
law.p:
Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of the same, that from and after the passage of this Act there shall be a board of commissioners of roads and revenues for the County of White in the State of Georgia, to consist of five members, who shall be freeholders of said County of White to be elected by the Grand Jury of said White County, two to be elected at the October term, 1930, of the superior court of said White County for the
full term of three years, said term beginning January 1st, 1931, two to be elected at the October term, 1931, of the superior court of said White County for the full term of three years, beginning January 1st, 1932, and one to be elected at the October term, 1932, of the superior court of said White County for the full term of three years, beginning January 1st, 1933. All elections to be at the October term of said White superior court next before the expiration of terms, unless in case or cases of vacancies. Board created.Election by grand jury.

Sec. 2. Be it further enacted that the grand jury so electing the member or members of said board shall in no event elect as a member of said board any person on the grand jury or who was drawn as a grand juror at the term said election is had. Disqualification of grand jurors.

Sec. 3. Be it further enacted, that a quorum of said board shall consist of not less than three members, save only where as many as four members are out of the county or otherwise disqualified; then and in that event the one commissioner who is at the time in said county and is not disqualified may perform the duties of said board, and this only in cases of emergency and so long as such condition shall exist. Quorum.

Sec. 4. Be it further enacted, that when a vacancy by death, resignation, or otherwise shall occur on said board, that fact shall be certified to the judge of the superior court by the other member or members of said board, and such judge of the superior court of White County shall fill said vacancy by appointment, and the person or persons so appointed shall hold office until the next meeting of the grand jury of White County when said vacancy or vacancies shall be filled by the grand jury, and the person or persons so elected by the grand jury shall hold for the unexpired term or terms of the office of the member or members dying or resigning as herein provided. Vacancy.

Sec. 5. Be it further enacted, that the compensation of said commissioners of roads and revenues shall be three
dollars per day for each day's service rendered as such commissioners. Per diem of commissioners.

Sec. 6. Be it further enacted that said board of commissioners shall elect a competent clerk for said board, whose duty it shall be to attend all meetings of said board and keep all records that are necessary to be kept, and to properly record all proceedings of said board in well bound books to be provided by said board, and carry on all correspondence necessary to be carried on, and said board shall be authorized to pay said clerk the sum of three dollars per day for all time that he may be engaged as such clerk, either at regular meetings or called meetings, and for recording the proceedings of said board. Clerk; election duties, pay.

Sec. 7. Be it further enacted, that said board shall have power, and they are hereby authorized, if in their opinion it will be to the interest of the county, to employ a suitable and competent road supervisor, whose duty it shall be to look after the public roads of the county and such duties as said board may require of him, and the said board may employ, if in their judgment the interest of the county would be best served thereby, a civil engineer to lay out roads and change roads when they may deem it proper, said supervisor or engineer to be paid such compensation as may be agreed upon by said commissioners out of the road funds of the county. Road supervisor.
